testcase.brief: All types of hash(HMAC) method should work, both phase 1 and 2
testcase.description:
Pre-Condition:
Test Procedure:
1. Verify that default Hash algorithm is SHA1 2. Check that the proposal contains hybrid in first exchanged 3. Verify that the content of "show vpn ike configuration"is according to 4. Verify that the config mode and phass II is hased by SHA1. 5. Repeated the upper step for MD5 6. Repeated the upper step for abg box

step.desc: config mgt0.1 with dhcp service enable
step.telnet: -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server ip-pool ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_start} ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_end}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options netmask 255.255.255.0" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options default-gateway ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options dns1 ${pub.dns1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server enable"

step.multi-setvar: echo "br1.br.mgt0.1.route=$(echo ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip} | cut -d. -f1,2,3).0" echo "cvg1.dns1.route=$(echo ${cvg1.dns1.ip} | cut -d. -f1,2,3).0" echo "cvg1.dns2.route=$(echo ${cvg1.dns2.ip} | cut -d. -f1,2,3).0" echo "cvg1.vpc1.route=$(echo ${cvg1.vpc1.tif.ip} | cut -d. -f1,2,3).0"

step.desc: On GW, will add the tunnel routes according to BR's modification

1. Verify that default Hash algorithm is SHA1 2. Check that the proposal contains hybrid in first exchanged 3. Verify that the content of “show vpn ike configuration”is according to 4. Verify that the config mode and phass II is hased by SHA1.
step.log-match: -b "configuration name:.+${br1.tunnel.name}.+" -ps p "nonce_size 16;" -ps p "phase1 proposal" -ps p "dh_group modp1024;" -ps p "encryption_algorithm aes;" -ps p "encryption_algorithm length 128;" -ps p "hash_algorithm sha1;" -ps p "phase2 proposal" -ps p "dh_group modp1024;" -ps p "encryption_algorithm aes;" -ps p "encryption_algorithm length 128;" -e "hash_algorithm sha1;" -f ${log.dir}/${log.file}

step.desc: setup eth interface as access mode

step.telnet: -v "user-profile sta qos-policy def-user-qos vlan-id ${br1.vpc1.vlan} attribute 1" -v "interface eth1 mode bridge-access user-profile-attribute 1"

step.desc: Laptop1 connect to lan port eth2
set br1.vpc1.tif.ip var for vpc1 on BR side
check the vpn ike sa on BR

1. Verify that default Hash algorithm is SHA1 2. Check that the proposal contains hybrid in first exchanged 3. Verify that the content of “show vpn ike configuration”is according to 4. Verify that the config mode and phass II is hased by SHA1.
step.log-match: -b "configuration name:.+${br1.tunnel.name}.+" -ps p "nonce_size 16;" -ps p "phase1 proposal" -ps p "dh_group modp1024;" -ps p "encryption_algorithm aes;" -ps p "encryption_algorithm length 128;" -ps p "hash_algorithm md5;" -ps p "phase2 proposal" -ps p "dh_group modp1024;" -ps p "encryption_algorithm aes;" -ps p "encryption_algorithm length 128;" -e "hash_algorithm sha1;" -f ${log.dir}/${log.file}

step.telnet: -v "vpn ipsec-tunnel ${br1.tunnel.name} ike phase2 hash md5" -v "clear log buffer" -v "_debug brd basic"

step.desc: check vpn ke sa on BR

step.telnet: -v "show log buffer" -v "show ip route" -v "clear log buffer"

step.desc: 1. Verify that default Hash algorithm is SHA1 2. Check that the proposal contains hybrid in first exchanged 3. Verify that the content of “show vpn ike configuration”is according to 4. Verify that the config mode and phass II is hased by SHA1.
step.log-match: -b "configuration name:.+${br1.tunnel.name}.+" -ps p "nonce_size 16;" -ps p "phase1 proposal" -ps p "dh_group modp1024;" -ps p "encryption_algorithm aes;" -ps p "encryption_algorithm length 128;" -ps p "hash_algorithm md5;" -ps p "phase2 proposal" -ps p "dh_group modp1024;" -ps p "encryption_algorithm aes;" -ps p "encryption_algorithm length 128;" -e "hash_algorithm md5;" -f ${log.dir}/${log.file}
